messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
I'm calling from 1109 East Alameda. There's been a shooting. I just shot a man who was attacking me.
Is he injured?
He's down and hurt bad.
What's your name, sir?
My name is Edwin Waters.
What's the telephone number you're calling from, sir?
970-209-6887. Please, hurry.
Do you still have the gun in your hand?
I set it on the table right here. Please come quick.
I understand, we're going to get someone out there, okay?
Yes, please.
Can you verify the address for me one more time?
1109 East Alameda.
Are you with the patient now?
His brother is. I'm about 15 feet away.
How old is the patient?
I'm going to guess 45.
Is he awake?
I don't know. His brother is talking to him.
Is he breathing?
I don't know. This is crazy. I've never done this kind of stuff before.
I understand. I just need to ask these questions, okay? Stay calm.
I am.
Is there any serious bleeding?
I'm sure. I don't know. I shot until the gun quit shooting.
Is he completely alert?
I have no idea. I have not gone over.
What part of the body was injured?
It's dark out here. I think I shot him in the chest.
Is there more than one wound?
I'm sure. I just started shooting until it quit.
Thank you. I'm going to give you some instructions for the ambulance, okay? Stay on the line with me.
Okay.
Do not pull out the bullet. Reassure him that help is on the way.
Help is on the way. The ambulance is coming right now.
Don't let him have anything to eat or drink. It might make him sick or cause problems for the doctor.
Okay. I'm sure he doesn't want to eat or drink now.
Do not move him unless it's absolutely necessary. Tell him to stay still and wait for help.
Okay.
I want you to watch him closely. If he becomes less awake or vomits, turn him on his side.
Okay.
Have someone meet the paramedics, and if he gets worse in any way, call us back immediately.
I hear the ambulance coming.
I'll stay on the line with you until they get there.
Okay, thank you.
You said you put the weapon down, right?
Yes, I put the gun down and ejected and dropped the clip out of it. It's laying here on the table.
What caliber is the gun?
Is this in your house or outside?
It was right at the back door, where I was in.
Where is he laying now?
He's laying on the ground about eight feet away, still outside.
Which is the easiest way for them to enter the house?
Come up into the driveway. I'll put the porch light on. He's right behind the house.
Okay. Come up Alameda. You said you unloaded the weapon, correct?
I don't know if I unloaded it fully, but I dropped the clip.
Just leave the weapon there and do not touch it.
I will not touch it.
What was he doing? Why was he at your back door?
He broke into my house while I was gone at my dad's funeral, and he's been yelling at me all day from across the parking lot. He was drinking with his friends and came rushing at me.
What's he doing now? Is he still with his brother?
His brother is there with him, and another friend is around him too.
Do you know the person you shot?
Yes, he's the brother-in-law of the people I'm working for.
Did anybody else have any weapons?
Not that I know of.
Okay, let me know when they're there.
They must be close because there's all kinds of noise outside.
Is it 1115 East Alameda or 1109?
Okay, and they're in the backyard?
Yes.
Come through quickly. It's right here on the table.
Are they there with you, sir?
Yes, there's an officer here right now.
I'm going to let you go now that the officers are there, okay?
Okay, thank you.
You're very welcome. Goodbye.
